name: Alpha Prime
description: Somewhere in deep space, at an apparently abandoned mining base on the asteriod Alpha Prime, something has gone terribly wrong. Miners were warned that the hubbardium they were mining was too dangerous, but the lure of unimaginable wealth was too strong.
minimum_requirements: Supported OS: Windows® 2000/XP/Vista Processor: 2.0 GHz Processor  Memory: 512 MB RAM  Graphics: DirectX compatible 128 MB graphics card  DirectX Version: DirectX® 9.0c Sound: DirectX compatible sound card Hard Drive: 3 GB Hard Drive space

reviews.review_text: If you want torture, buy it!  Graphics are ok.  About 5 hours long AI is unbalanced. You WILL die a lot! I swear they have accuracy in the high 80s Weapons suck. Too many close range weapons and the long range weapons you'll run out of ammo quickly Story is forgetable Unstable framerate when you die and reload your save. Ran around 250-300fps. Dropped to <20 after reload. Takes time to stablalize  It's $5

The current Metacritic score of 59 basically says it all. I got this game for almost nothing in a bundle, and it's not god-awful. But the story is confusing/poorly translated, the bad guys all crackshots, the puzzles uninspiring, and after basically getting stuck the second or third time, I gave up going back to YouTube walkthroughs and just threw in the towel. I honestly tried to give this game a chance, but it just became joyless work after awhile.

Based on the reviews, I was expecting a really badly made game. However, I was somewhat surprised. Sure, Alpha Prime is nothing extraordinary, but it's not crap by any means either.  It's a standard corridor FPS with a story. If you like FPS games, there is nothing to complain about here, aside from perhaps the difficulty being a bit too high. I've played on Easy and even then some sections were unusually hard and caused me to die many times.  The story isn't bad either. Again, it's nothing groundbreaking, but for an FPS game it's pretty decent. Most FPS games don't make anywhere near the effort in the story department as Alpha Prime does. The cutscenes and the radio dialogue sections between the characters were a nice addition to keep the game interesting. Most characters were developed reasonably well in terms of personality.  The graphics are very nice. Considering the game came out in 2007, those are pretty decent visuals, even by today's standards. The music is also not bad. There are only about 1 or 2 jarring heavy rock tracks, but the rest of the soundtrack is pretty good and gives a nice epic feel to the battles.  The enemy variety could've certainly used some work. You spend a good 80% of the game just fighting spec ops, which gets repetitive eventually. There are some other gameplay sections added too, like hacking, and using a loader to move boxes out of the way, which is a nice change of pace, even if some sections were quite annoying. The loader in particular was difficult to control, and having to move a dozen of boxes out of the way just felt like a waste of time.  In general the game is not as bad as the reviews claim it to be. It's just a standard, above average FPS that will keep you entertained for a few hours. If you are into the genre, give it a try, otherwise pass it up.
Review for Alpha Prime

The good  Occasionally clean and crisp visuals Raging soundtrack Good weapon effects It was cheap Outdoor areas are all right   The bad  Boring indoor level design Too short AI is brutal, even on easy mode Enemies never miss and they see you from miles away Voice acting is awful Buggy physics are terrible (that's buggy as in vehicle-type of buggy) Story is meh No multiplayer Brings nothing new to the FPS scene. You've seen it all before

On the plus side, Alpha Prime’s cut scenes are so bad they’re almost amusing. Monotone voices recite bizarre dialog, main character Arnold makes side remarks to his ally Livia, then Pablo turns up with his broken English and immediately starts taking about flotillas hidden in shoes. What?!  Alpha Prime reminds me of the generic Doom clones that came out in the early 90’s when everybody and their mother was having a go at making these games. You wander down generic corridors, often without any objective. Robotic foes turn up and stand largely motionless while their hitscan weapons cause your health bar to deplete, and you fire back with an arsenal seemingly manufactured by Fisherprice,   Also who names their FPS protagonist Arnold?

For the most part, I’d say that the weak points overpower the few positives in Alpha Prime and because there isn’t anything that’s really new or unique and the sound ruins the intensity, I find it fairly boring. You shoot enemies, watch a cut scene, shoot some more, interact with something, repeat.A pretty shell for a game that's pretty lacking. Not much fun. Flashy weapon effects partially mask the mediocre gameplay, and to the untrained eye, Alpha Prime could almost pass as 'Doom 3'.All in all this game is solidly average. It’s a decent if predictable story saddled with a pedestrian game.
Bill Murray takes on a rogue military on an alien planet.

A fairly standard FPS, with a bit of an old-school bent to the gameplay. I like the simple and fun shooting mechanics. The engine is actually quite nice looking, with shaders reminescent of IDTECH4 games. The story could have been quite excellent, but it was not fleshed out well.  Weapons are okay, though not all of them are useful. Enemies are difficult but not very intelligent. Oh, and Bellini is one of the worst steretypes of an Italian I've ever had to endure in anything. That was quite insulting :P
Boring and meaningless first person shooter. My motivaton to finish this game was and is zero, this game is not innovative and no fun.

This is definitely an extremely low budget game with terrible voice acting, lackluster graphics and gameplay and (so far) a random tossed in story. The game runs well enough but it's far from good. The AI is unrelenting and can often shoot you when you can't see them. It's challenging in that you have to react to the perfect AI or die from getting caught off guard. Also never jump off the obvious path or you will die to death barriers.. Not the worst game I've ever played, but there is definitely nothing redeeeming unless you're just really desperate for a really cheap FPS. Do not pay more than $1 for this game.

Game was a nostalgic blast for me. Solid shooter that clearly takes its influence from the Half-life 2 style era while looking like a prettier and more optimistic Doom 3. However it honestly has better gunplay than both. ADS, peeking, solid hit detection, good feeling to the guns, and challenging shoot outs with an optional bullet time element and some occasional triggerable eviromental bits through the game's 'hacking' feature. The game is also a lot of fun with how it lets you toy with the world around you with some gimmicky but fun physics that range from lifting lids off of crates for ammo to simply playing basketball in a gym room. Oh and no regenerating health, you find your supplies across dispencers and pick-ups like it should be done giving the game more depth and challenge. Its mostly raw solid gunplay and shooter action following familiar mechanics that works out pretty well. The game also has some of the best music I've probably heard in a long time from an FPS game, and the best part is it's free on their website.  The game attempts a story, but the less said about it might be for the best as it really isn't that great and far from the highlight of the game. By the end the plot seems a bit confused of itself and ends on a note that will likely just leave you scratching your head. Meanwhile another thing worth noting on the downside is that several of the game's special mechanics get a little underplayed on the last two levels with the bullet time recourse running low, and hackable objects basically removed from battles. The game is also critcized for near perfect AI aim, which is true but honestly I think it actually added to the fun. Peaking around corners and trying to hit headshots before they shot back at me was just a part of adapting to the gunplay and felt natural. The AI also moves around, doges, calls out orders, and fliches to damage also giving them more life and opening them up to weak points making their aimbot skills more tolerable.   At the end of the day I really enjoyed this game and it kind of made me sad we don't get games like this anymore. It had a weird plastic sci-fi feeling with amazing industrial techno rock music that felt right and sort of felt nostalgic of the 90's/early 2000's while giving me gameplay from a better era of corridor shooters. I'd recomend this game to people who grew up around an earlier era of FPS, or just want a bit of an escape from the current market for a good cheap action packed FPS. I suppose you could look at it as a cheesy fun comfort game in that regard. Oh and again, its cheap... $5.... considering people are buying retro 2D torture platformers for double or more, I'd say this is a steal of a deal by comparison.

This isn't worth the money. There's no point in beating around the bush.  The story is unoriginal and bland with little keeping you going. The gunplay is boring and uninspired. Poor modeling. Poor lip sync. No form of story build up.   All around, a pretty poor design and execution.
Pretty good, if you like stupid garbage for clowns.
Happened to get this game through Humble Bundle. Not worth your time at all, there are hundreds of games that are better than this one. Plain and uninteresting.

Alpha Prime is an OK game.  I played it, liked it at the start but got to the point where i didn't know what to.  6/10.
Alpha Prime is an OK game.  I played it, liked it at the start but got to the point where i didn't know what to.  6/10.

This is a fairly short B-list sci-fi shooter without many pretentions. It was released in 2007, so you should be expecting dated graphics. If you are able to look past these defects (and some bad voice over and questionable choice of weaponry too), you can find here the type of game that it's fun to romp in about for a while and that does not overstay its welcome.  It is worth a playthrough, as long as you keep your expectations in check.
Alpha Prime fast game with modern day graphics with easy controls that moves from location A to B to C and so on,  good amount of action and special effects  good game.

While there is zero reason for me to say anything good about this 'game' this piece of software is the worst 'game' ever first of all the voice acting is so laughably bad that i could never take anything seriously the levels are extremely linear with some to no rewards for exploring the actual programming on this software is the worst of any product on steam first of all the controls are a mess i have all the sliders at max and i move around like my sliders aren't even on not only that the click is sometimes extremely delayed and i'd be killed because of my controls the music well i don't think i heard any through out what i played of this game please don't even think of buying this usless product because the game is on of the worst games i've ever played i bought this for .39 and i still feel ripped off this game is total ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥

Keep in mind, just because I'm voting 'recommend', doesn't mean you should actually play it by my recommendation, I just don't feel like a red thumbs down is very fitting of this game. If you have this game or have access to it for free, I would say go for it, but don't pay money for this, your time will be better spent on another FPS... or you know... in the real world.   The storyline is sort of bland: Arnold, your silver fox, body builder, genius badass is mining a mysterious radioactive ore on some planet in some fictional universe with humans. He is the only one not being driven mad and so you have to shoot your way out of the space ship and blah blah standard Sci-Fi FPS.  Spoilers ahead??? The differences: Oxygen depletion happens when you're not in a sealed structure or breathing directly through an oxygen mask on a wall. When outside, you have to move quickly and get to the next oxygen mask to strategically plan your next move. You can also save at any time and will probably need to do that a lot because of how often you die. There are a standard set of guns, although the flamethrower is sort of sadly useless... There are some cool tech gadgets, where you can hack cameras and mines through the walls before entering a room. Some missions require you to carry [giant] batteries with you to restore power to doors and such. So overall although they did mix it up and add some spice to the gameplay, its still primarily an (almost) outdated FPS.  The storyline is lacking, but certainly has some [randomly] brash lines, and decent voice acting. The protagonist has solid voice acting actually, in fact, one of the better voices I've heard considering the lines he was reading were complete ♥♥♥♥ half of the time. Some of the other characters sound like they read one line per day with the same inflection and different words, particularly the foreign guy without much experience in English.  The most memorable and worthy lines of the game, that convinced me to keep playing during a hard and honestly boring part:   'Arnold, you'll have to hold them off just a little bit longer!!!', says the other character while he was hacking a computer-motherboard-mainframe-core-system to save both of their lives.  'Why? So you can finish surfing porn?' Arnold is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and a badass even when a tech guru is saving his life and he is shotgunning 20 dudes at once.  The game is hard, like 2007 hard. I'm saying like you can't just play this game through casually on normal difficulty because people will actually hit you with most of their bullets and rockets (Although, even in the hands of the villain, the flamethrower sucks ♥♥♥ unless you're stuck in an elevator with them).    TL;DR: I know I've just expressed a lot of conflicting like and dislike for this game, but that's how it feels to play it overall, you like it, and then you kind of wish you didn't spend an hour playing it, especially when you forget to save for a half hour and then get smoked by a big fat robot rocket.   Slow, tactful, diverse.  Enjoy.
boring story, bad gameplay, its just mot a good game. your better off buying somthing else. not worth $5

Alpha Prime is one of the most basic FPS games I've come across. It really shows it's age as a 2007 release, the voice acting is one of the worst I've ever heard.   The A.I here has some sort of aimbot scripted into it, because it will get brutally hard, enemies do not miss, your health soon drops into the red zone in most battles. I paid little attention to the story once I heard the voices, one of them is so bad it's almost comical that it was included in the game.   For £2,99 is it worth it? Probably? You can get about six hours out of the single-player campaign and that's it. There is zero reasons to keep it installed once you finish it.
Nope
Don't buy this game. It will tempt you with its $5 price, but it's an ugly, buggy, poorly done game. I'm ashamed I played 7hrs before remembering I owned Bioshock.
Too short.. but fun.
better than i thought it would be. needs controller support. fun.

Ok, this is going to be my first negative review.  This game is just HORRENDOUS.  I don't know how this game has a metacritic of 59/100..........well..........I do know.  Do I recommend this game? FFS NO  But if you want to waste 4.99€ (0,99€ until 22 june) fighting the same ♥♥♥♥ing enemy all the time......go for it.

Avoid this Game like its got herpes. Not worth the 5 bucks i paid for it. Extrodinarally weak gameplay coupled with clunky hard to use keyboard+mouse controls. The weapons are seriously weak (Pistol, shotgun, chaingun, rocket launcher..... uh... doom anyone?)  The 'quests' you go on for this game are also lame and lack any real thought... basically 'go here, shoot this, find the blue key... etc, etc.'  Dont buy this game... you've been warned.  (FPS)

Cons : - Subpar graphics for the time - Hilariously bad voice acting - One of the worst video game sci-fi scenarios I've ver seen - As a result, none of what's going on or any characters or places are memorable - Standard and boring weapons - There's no life in the gun animations and sounds - Forgettable soundtrack - Experienced glitches and crashes - No originality whatsoever  Pros : - You'll put many, many hours into it if you're looking for pros, so that's a pro in itself - Still looking

Your character is a ♥♥♥♥ing boss, and he can swing his hammer at the speed of light. The cinematics are a litte bit long and can get boring, but he can swing his hammer at the speed of light.  Did I mention you can swing your hammer at the speed of light? I have never had a more destructive tool in my hands. You can literally devastate your enemies with the hammer...that you can swing at the speed of light!
I've played around 90 minutes so far and I must say for the 36 pence I paid for it - it's marvelous! If you have a spair quid, and is looking for an 'old school' shooter this is the game for you!
Bought this game some years ago (well over 5 years) during a Steam Xmas sale because somone said it was worth $1.69. Have only 0.9 hrs on record which says it all about this game.

Just tried playing Alpha Prime. The game has decent graphics for a 2007 game, it plays very smoothly, but it has a ton of flaws in my opinion. First, options are lacking, especially sound options. I wanted to try and get the game music down but NPC chatter and cutscene sound higher than that, like I usually do, and there's no separation for that, but maybe they just cut corners on that end. The other thing that really eludes me is what am I doing in the game. I assume there's a storyline and that there are explanations and reasons for what I'm doing, but I don't know them, and I have no idea when are they planning on telling me more than the fact that my name is Arnold. Third, I played the game for 20 minutes, and I already got 4 out of 8 weapons in the game. Why are you making it that easy on me? It's like this is going to be a hour and a half completion time for this game. Nevertheless I didn't really enjoy the game and I call it quits on this one. Some old games are fun to play, like Fable TLC and Duke Nukem: Manhattan Project for me, but this one isn't one of them, sadly. If you got the game whenever and however, I wouldn't recommend playing it, it feels insanely weird in my honest opinion, and the fact I have no idea what am I doing is driving me crazy.
this game truly is the greatest thing to grace my beautiful eyes.  'its like doom 3 with guns' - machinima
Funny dialogue and great story xD 8/10
my mom wouldn't let me play this game because you can use drugs but i heard it's cool

Simply one of the worst FPS games I've ever had the displeasure of playing. Subpar gunplay mechanics, chintzy graphics, horrendously bad voice acting, and at least one game-stopping bug that can completely prevent you from advancing further than a couple hours in. Do not buy, under any circumstances -- there are hundreds of better shooters out there to choose from.

This game is alright, but it is pretty damn glitchy. A few times, it just brought my computer down, and my computer is actually pretty powerful! Besides that, there's no other reason to play this game, really. The gameplay is average, the story is average, the voice acting... oh boy. If you REALLY want to play this game, okay, go ahead, but I don't think it's worth $5.
this is a really good game. you mmight have to get used to the controls, but the game is really good.

An amazing trip into one of the genre's classics. Excellent shooting action, great AI, awesome graphics and great sound effects, gathering together to provide a perfect FPS experience. Highly recommended for anyone interested in quality gaming time.  jk, it's ♥♥♥♥.
0 / 10  I guess most of their funding went into purchasing the X-Fi certification or something, everything else needs a lot of work.

Short, very straight forward FPS. With nothing outstanding, is an average game with an average story for a rainy-lonely afternoon (if you don't have anything else to do). Enemies have a very accurate aim so play it on hard make it... well... hard to play. Worthy only if you get it in a bundle, otherwise is 'neh'.

Glitchy. Somewhat unstable. Bad voice acting. Uninteresting cutscenes. Rather useless sounds. Boring weapons and aiming with them reduces playability, visibility and gives only a slightly smaller reticle. Overall nothing in this game feels like a finished feature. 3 months more polishing and the game would feel a lot better.  As it is, the game is definitely not worth much. Although being an FPS game I do not think the combat has anything to offer really, so if you buy this game dirt cheap and want to play it through you should just drop the difficulty level to easy and run it through. Yes, you can play the game with higher settings but it does not make the game any more interesting as the combat is what it is.  I'd say the price cap for this game is around 2€.

wierd; all those companies names in the game intro credits; who watched silicon valley may get an idea that each of those companies were actually just 1 programer guy, LoL, well? betwen this and Rise of the Pooh(Rise of the Triad), well think about it, at least in this one u can save the progress and the frames is way much better than the Rise of the Pooh, LOL.

This game is really underrated. A simple and solid shooter. The enemies are powerful. You can't just run and gun, you have think and use tactics. It's a real challenge unlike some other FPS i have played. Think I picked it up in a Steam sale for an absolutle bargain price of 95p!

Great game. It came out in 2007 and it didn't exactly have the budget of a Call Of Duty game, but its still a reasonable game. The voice acting is funny, thought you might think its corny. But alas, shooting stuff = fun.  And the best part about this game is you don't need a Average or HIGH powered computer. You can have a seriously weak computer and it will run fine.  7/10 I recomend this game to people who are nice, and don't have an agressive out-take on life. ie. easy going people.  Enjoy.
Pretty good game but has a few quirks
Waste of time.  Enemies hit always and drain your health in about 3 seconds, story ist pretty boring and overall the game is too short.

If you like cheap fun mindless shooters and you don't mind bad acting in cutscenes between levels (although they can be very funny at some points :-P), Alpha Prime is a good game to play. It can be very tough at times though so make sure your reflexes and mouse aiming skills are top-notch :-).

Solid sci-fi shooter that definitely has its own atmosphere. The plot is neither good nor bad, shooting is quite mediocre. There is basic hacking part and good planet surface rides. I wonder why nobody mention the music in this game. Music is good, sometimes VERY good. Planet landscapes and music are things I enjoyed the most.
its kinda like if you took deadspace and halflife and put them together in a not so awsome story.  the story is crap. the gameplay is fun.
like a half life 3 preview
Generic space FPS with an odd 'hacking' mechanic. Also robots that don't miss their shots.

For a Summer Comedy without Adam Sandler, it's pretty funny.

The game isn't without it probems (the enemies are crackshots even from the other side of the levels, making it a pretty ifficult game) but it is also pretty fun. It has a good supply of different weapons for you to enjoy.   The level designs can get a bit samey and I found it pretty easy to get lost at times, especially when you have to start ouble-backing on yourself to earlier parts of the game.   Overall though it your a fan of mid-tier FPS' you'll find some things to enjoy here.

Mediocre moments at best. Riddled with game breaking bugs and very poor voice acting. I would have liked to have finished it but forementioned bugs didn't let that happen. Gameplay was also moderately satisfying, most of the weapons were worthless 10 minutes into the game. Felt very unfinished.
Passed but lost so many nerves
Great sci-fi FPS. If you like those kinds of games you'll probably like it.
Honestly not a huge fan.  The mechanics are smooth enough that the game is playable, but awkward enough that the whole game just feels weird...
